description: {"blocks":[{"key":"44a1i","text":"This protocol describes steps for ex vivo electrophysiology in mouse brain slices. This protocol also includes instructions for clozapine N-oxide (CNO) testing in DREADD-expressing neurons.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"bptvs","text":"Isoflurane","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5eb8d","text":"Rodent guillotine","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f7g4p","text":"Vibratome (Campden Instruments, 7000smz-2)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"181nu","text":"aCSF solution containing (in mM): 119 NaCl, 2.5 KCl, 1.3 MgSO4, 1.0 NaH2PO4, 2.5 CaCl2, 26.2 NaHCO3, and 11 glucose saturated with 95% O2—5% CO2","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":61,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":71,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":74,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":85,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":98,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":136,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":143,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8u5jm","text":"3 – 5 MOhm pipettes containing (in mM): 123 K-gluconate, 10 HEPES, 0.2 EGTA, 8 NaCl, 2 MgATP, and 0.3 Na3GTP, pH 7.2, osmolarity adjusted to 275. Biocytin (0.1%, Sigma) is included in the internal solution to identify neurons after recordings where desired.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d8qrp","text":"Axio Examiner A1 equipped with Dodt and IR optics","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b71ue","text":"Zeiss Axiocam 506 mono","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2l0vh","text":"Neurolucida 2023 software","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a3i94","text":"Sutter IPA and SutterPatch v2.3.1 software (Sutter Instruments)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5h7sr","text":"Clozapine N-oxide (for DREADD-expressing neurons; Tocris)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ggq0","text":"4% formaldehyde in PBS","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1rutl","text":"Deeply anesthetize the mouse with isofluorane, decapitate, and remove the brain.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"90a2m","text":"Using a vibratome, cut 150mm horizontal slices containing the region of interest in ice-cold aCSF solution and allow to recover at 33˚ C in aCSF for at least one hour.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3jhcm","text":"For fluorescent imaging, visualize slices under an Axio Examiner A1 equipped with Dodt and IR optics using a Zeiss Axiocam 506 mono and Neruolucida 2023 software.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c6aip","text":"Whole-cell patch-clamp recordings are made at 33˚ C using 3 – 5 MOhm pipettes. Recordings are made using Sutter IPA and SutterPatch v2.3.1 software (Sutter Instruments), filtered at 5 kHz and collected at 10 kHz.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c0oa1","text":"For Ih: voltage clamp cells at -60mV and step to -40, -50, -70, -80, -90, -100, -110, and -120 mV. Ih magnitude is quantified as the difference between the initial steady-state response to the -120mV step and the asymptote of the slow current sag.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":4,"length":1},{"style":"italic","offset":99,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":5,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":100,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6vupl","text":"For spontaneous firing rates: record in current-clamp mode (I= 0 pA). Spontaneous firing rate is measured as the mean firing rate during the first 2 min of whole-cell recording. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":60,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aslf1","text":"Action potential (AP) waveform measurements are made from averages across at least 8 APs from the first 2 min of recording.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3ll3m","text":"For input resistance: Apply a brief hyperpolarizing pulse once every 10 sec and average across the measurements made during the first 2 min of recording.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2q04h","text":"For CNO testing in DREADD-expressing neurons: spontaneous firing rate or resting membrane potential are monitored until a stable baseline is observed for at least 5 min. Then switch the perfusion solution to 1mM CNO for 5 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"808mv","text":"When recordings are complete, drop fix slices in 4% formaldehyde in PBS for at least 2 hr.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d7ojs","text":"Complete statistical analyses in R, first testing whether data meet the criteria for parametric statistical evaluation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Ex vivo electrophysiology
